front.title: Using Two Octets for Bandwidth Values in OSPF and ISIS extensions for Traffic Engineering

abstract.t: In OSPF and ISIS extensions for support of traffic engineering, sub- TLVs with values of link bandwidth are advertised. Currently a bandwidth value is denoted by a 4-byte IEEE floating number. This draft proposes a simple way to use two octets to represent a bandwidth value used in traffic engineering sub-TLVs
